intro: Tofieldia glutinosa subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western stickyflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to western North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their showy, grass-like inflorescences. The plant produces dense clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers, which are often sticky to the touch due to the presence of glandular structures. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
